column1: #Text=Mile End , the last Mile , is a small neighborhood between Outremont , Le Plateau , Rosemont and Little Italy .
#Text=The main commercial streets are parts of St-Viateur , Fairmount , Bernard , Villeneuve , Parc Ave & St-Laurent .
#Text=It has bagel shops ( 2 on Fairmount and 2 on St-Viateur ) , plenty of little restaurants and shops and is best known for its lively Italian coffee shops .
#Text=The nearest metro station is outside the Mile-End : Laurier on the orange line .
#Text=Alternatively , take the 80 bus from metro stations Place-des-Arts ( green line ) or Du Parc ( blue line ) .
#Text=Church of St. Michael and St. Anthony , 5580 rue St-Urbain .
#Text=The two main commercial streets in the Mile-End are Bernard and St-Viateur .
#Text=Stroll your way through fine food shops , independent book shops and independent clothing shops featuring local designers as well as kitschy vintage second-hand clothing .
#Text=The Mile-End is home to the two most renowned bagel shops of Montreal : St-Viateur Bagel and Fairmount Bagel .
#Text=These shops do not offer seating , but you can sit in a nearby park to eat your bagels while they are hot .
#Text=For the complete experience , do a picnic with fresh bagels , smoked salmon and cream cheese .
#Text=The Mile-End is home to many fine food shops and organic markets , including :
#Text=Fine food shops boasting an excellent olive bar and many European importations .
#Text=It is one of the rare places to buy truffles in Montreal .
#Text=A nice vegetarian café and bistro , Le Cagibi is also a hot spot of the emerging experimental music scene with live shows most nights of the week .
#Text=La Poule ( Bernard between Waverly and de l'Esplanade ) .
#Text=One of the best Portuguese-style chicken restaurants in the entire city ( and there are quite a few . )
#Text=It 's owned by an Italian woman and the head chef is a Moroccan man , but no matter .
#Text=Served with piri-piri hot sauce , choice of salads and a huge pile of fresh fries .
#Text=Lots of other things on the menu but do n't bother .
#Text=It 's all about la poule ( the chicken ) .
#Text=A Greek restaurant specialized souvlaki and doner .
#Text=A chain , and not a great one at that .
#Text=Known for good North American style pizza .
#Text=Les Deux Singes de Montarvie , 176 rue St-Viateur Ouest , ☏ +1514 278-6854 .
#Text=A unique bar with emphasis on local products including homemade beers , ciders , and North American wines .

#Text=On the food side , you will find tapas like platters prepared with fresh ingredients : fish and meat tartares , duck magret , Québec cheeses , rillete , foie-gras , the famous veal mini-burgers , and also vegetable dishes .
#Text=Food is not necessarily of the quality one would expect for the price , however .
#Text=$ 4 draft beer ( $ 5.50 for pint ) , 5 to 8 prices on tap .
